title: CA transaction - U.S. sells products to China

content.prompt: Which of the following would be a current account transaction?

choices.label: India buys $10 billion of new United States Treasury bonds.
A United States firm buys 5 percent of the stock of another United States firm.
A United States firm builds a new factory in Kenya.
A United States firm sells $500 million of its products to a Chinese company.
The United States buys $8 billion worth of euros.

unit.text: 6: Open Economy - International Trade and Finance

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model illustrated by an example.
